The UAE Fibre Optics market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 3.8% during 2024-2030. The market is driven by the expansion of the Information and Communication Technology (ICT) sector, digital transformation, and the knowledge economy. The Dubai Electricity and Water Authority (DEWA) has completed the extension of over 350 kilometers of Fibre Optic (FO) ducts, expanding the total length to 3,634 kilometers by year-end. This expansion aligns with the UAE's vision for a digitally empowered future.

The UAE has become a prominent position as one of the largest data center hubs in the Middle East, with plans for further expansion. Projections indicate up to $1 billion in additional investments by 2026 to support this growth trajectory. The rapid expansion of data center infrastructure in the UAE is profoundly impacting the Fibre optics market, driving significant demand for Fibre optics infrastructure.

The UAE Fibre optics market is significantly influenced by the telecom sector, driven by initiatives such as Dubai's Du and Oman's Omantel launch of the Oman Emirates Gateway (OEG) project. These projects underscore the telecom sector's commitment to advancing infrastructure and technology, which in turn drives the demand and growth of the Fibre optics market in the UAE.

Oracle announced the opening of its second cloud region in Abu Dhabi in November 2021, enhancing the existing Oracle Cloud Dubai Region. This strategic investment in data center infrastructure has propelled the UAE into a prominent position as one of the largest data center hubs in the Middle East.

The key companies in the UAE Fibre optics market include Vindhaya Telelinks Ltd., Corning Optical Communication GmbH & Co. KG, W. L. Gore & Associates, GmbH Middle East, Prysmian Group, Arabian Fibre Optic Cable Manufacturing LLC (AFOC), Naficon, STL Tech, ZTT International Ltd., Hengtong Group Co. Ltd., Yangtze Optical Fibre and Cable Co. Ltd.
